<S>1161</S> After<S>3326</S> these things<S>5023</S> Paul<S>3972</S> departed<S>5563</S> from<S>1537</S> Athens<S>116</S>, and came<S>2064</S> to<S>1519</S> Corinth<S>2882</S>;
And<S>2532</S> found<S>2147</S> a certain<S>5100</S> Jew<S>2453</S> named<S>3686</S> Aquila<S>207</S>, born<S>1085</S> in Pontus<S>4193</S>, lately<S>4373</S> come<S>2064</S> from<S>575</S> Italy<S>2482</S>, with<S>2532</S> his<S>846</S> wife<S>1135</S> Priscilla<S>4252</S>; (because that<S>1223</S> Claudius<S>2804</S> had commanded<S>1299</S> all<S>3956</S> Jews<S>2453</S> to depart<S>5563</S> from<S>1537</S> Rome<S>4516</S>:) and came<S>4334</S> unto them<S>846</S>.
And<S>2532</S> because<S>1223</S> he was<S>1511</S> of the same craft<S>3673</S>, he abode<S>3306</S> with<S>3844</S> them<S>846</S>, and<S>2532</S> wrought<S>2038</S>: for<S>1063</S> by their occupation<S>5078</S> they were<S>2258</S> tentmakers<S>4635</S>.
And<S>1161</S> he reasoned<S>1256</S> in<S>1722</S> the synagogue<S>4864</S> <S>2596</S> every<S>3956</S> sabbath<S>4521</S>, and<S>5037</S> persuaded<S>3982</S> the Jews<S>2453</S> and<S>2532</S> the Greeks<S>1672</S>.
And<S>1161</S> when<S>5613</S> <S>5037</S> Silas<S>4609</S> and<S>2532</S> Timotheus<S>5095</S> were come<S>2718</S> from<S>575</S> Macedonia<S>3109</S>, Paul<S>3972</S> was pressed<S>4912</S> in the spirit<S>4151</S>, and testified<S>1263</S> to the Jews<S>2453</S> that Jesus<S>2424</S> was Christ<S>5547</S>. <sup>was Christ: or, is the Christ</sup>
And<S>1161</S> when they opposed<S>498</S> themselves<S>846</S>, and<S>2532</S> blasphemed<S>987</S>, he shook<S>1621</S> his raiment<S>2440</S>, and said<S>2036</S> unto<S>4314</S> them<S>846</S>, Your<S>5216</S> blood<S>129</S> be upon<S>1909</S> your<S>5216</S> own heads<S>2776</S>; I<S>1473</S> am clean<S>2513</S>: from<S>575</S> henceforth<S>3568</S> I will go<S>4198</S> unto<S>1519</S> the Gentiles<S>1484</S>.
And<S>2532</S> he departed<S>3327</S> thence<S>1564</S>, and entered<S>2064</S> into<S>1519</S> a certain<S>5100</S> man's house<S>3614</S>, named<S>3686</S> Justus<S>2459</S>, one that worshipped<S>4576</S> God<S>2316</S>, whose<S>3739</S> house<S>3614</S> joined hard<S>4927</S> <S>2258</S> to the synagogue<S>4864</S>.
And<S>1161</S> Crispus<S>2921</S>, the chief ruler of the synagogue<S>752</S>, believed<S>4100</S> on the Lord<S>2962</S> with<S>4862</S> all<S>3650</S> his<S>846</S> house<S>3624</S>; and<S>2532</S> many<S>4183</S> of the Corinthians<S>2881</S> hearing<S>191</S> believed<S>4100</S>, and<S>2532</S> were baptized<S>907</S>.
Then<S>1161</S> spake<S>2036</S> the Lord<S>2962</S> to Paul<S>3972</S> in<S>1223</S> the night<S>3571</S> by<S>1722</S> a vision<S>3705</S>, Be<S>5399</S> not<S>3361</S> afraid<S>5399</S>, but<S>235</S> speak<S>2980</S>, and<S>2532</S> hold<S>4623</S> not<S>3361</S> thy peace<S>4623</S>:
For<S>1360</S> I<S>1473</S> am<S>1510</S> with<S>3326</S> thee<S>4675</S>, and<S>2532</S> no man<S>3762</S> shall set on<S>2007</S> thee<S>4671</S> to hurt<S>2559</S> thee<S>4571</S>: for<S>1360</S> I<S>3427</S> have<S>2076</S> much<S>4183</S> people<S>2992</S> in<S>1722</S> this<S>5026</S> city<S>4172</S>.
And<S>5037</S> he continued<S>2523</S> there a year<S>1763</S> and<S>2532</S> six<S>1803</S> months<S>3376</S>, teaching<S>1321</S> the word<S>3056</S> of God<S>2316</S> among<S>1722</S> them<S>846</S>. <sup>continued there: Gr. sat there</sup>
And<S>1161</S> when Gallio<S>1058</S> was the deputy<S>445</S> of Achaia<S>882</S>, the Jews<S>2453</S> made insurrection<S>2721</S> with one accord against<S>3661</S> Paul<S>3972</S>, and<S>2532</S> brought<S>71</S> him<S>846</S> to<S>1909</S> the judgment seat<S>968</S>,
Saying<S>3004</S>,<S>3754</S> This<S>3778</S> fellow persuadeth<S>374</S> men<S>444</S> to worship<S>4576</S> God<S>2316</S> contrary<S>3844</S> to the law<S>3551</S>.
And<S>1161</S> when Paul<S>3972</S> was now about<S>3195</S> to open<S>455</S> his mouth<S>4750</S>, Gallio<S>1058</S> said<S>2036</S> unto<S>4314</S> the Jews<S>2453</S>, If<S>1487</S> <S>3303</S> <S>3767</S> it were<S>2258</S> a<S>5100</S> matter of wrong<S>92</S> or<S>2228</S> wicked<S>4190</S> lewdness<S>4467</S>, O<S>5599</S> ye Jews<S>2453</S>, reason<S>2596</S> <S>3056</S> would<S>302</S> that I should bear<S>430</S> with you<S>5216</S>:
But<S>1161</S> if<S>1487</S> it be<S>2076</S> a question<S>2213</S> of<S>4012</S> words<S>3056</S> and<S>2532</S> names<S>3686</S>, and<S>2532</S> of <S>2596</S> your<S>5209</S> law<S>3551</S>, look ye<S>3700</S> <S>846</S> to it; for<S>1063</S> I<S>1473</S> will be<S>1014</S> <S>1511</S> no<S>3756</S> judge<S>2923</S> of such<S>5130</S> matters.
And<S>2532</S> he drave<S>556</S> them<S>846</S> from<S>575</S> the judgment seat<S>968</S>.
Then<S>1161</S> all<S>3956</S> the Greeks<S>1672</S> took<S>1949</S> Sosthenes<S>4988</S>, the chief ruler of the synagogue<S>752</S>, and beat<S>5180</S> him before<S>1715</S> the judgment seat<S>968</S>. And<S>2532</S> Gallio<S>1058</S> cared<S>3199</S> for none<S>3762</S> of those things<S>5130</S>.
And<S>1161</S> Paul<S>3972</S> after this tarried<S>4357</S> there yet<S>2089</S> a good<S>2425</S> while<S>2250</S>, and then took his leave<S>657</S> of the brethren<S>80</S>, and sailed thence<S>1602</S> into<S>1519</S> Syria<S>4947</S>, and<S>2532</S> with<S>4862</S> him<S>846</S> Priscilla<S>4252</S> and<S>2532</S> Aquila<S>207</S>; having shorn<S>2751</S> his head<S>2776</S> in<S>1722</S> Cenchrea<S>2747</S>: for<S>1063</S> he had<S>2192</S> a vow<S>2171</S>.
And<S>1161</S> he came<S>2658</S> to<S>1519</S> Ephesus<S>2181</S>, and<S>2548</S> left<S>2641</S> them there<S>847</S>: but<S>1161</S> he himself<S>846</S> entered<S>1525</S> into<S>1519</S> the synagogue<S>4864</S>, and reasoned with<S>1256</S> the Jews<S>2453</S>.
When<S>1161</S> they<S>846</S> desired<S>2065</S> him to tarry<S>3306</S> longer<S>1909</S> <S>4119</S> time<S>5550</S> with<S>3844</S> them<S>846</S>, he consented<S>1962</S> not<S>3756</S>;
But<S>235</S> bade<S>657</S> them<S>846</S> farewell<S>657</S>, saying<S>2036</S>, I<S>3165</S> must<S>1163</S> by all means<S>3843</S> keep<S>4160</S> this feast<S>1859</S> that cometh<S>2064</S> in<S>1519</S> Jerusalem<S>2414</S>: but<S>1161</S> I will return<S>344</S> again<S>3825</S> unto<S>4314</S> you<S>5209</S>, if God<S>2316</S> will<S>2309</S>. And<S>2532</S> he sailed<S>321</S> from<S>575</S> Ephesus<S>2181</S>.
And<S>2532</S> when he had landed<S>2718</S> at<S>1519</S> Caesarea<S>2542</S>, and gone up<S>305</S>, and<S>2532</S> saluted<S>782</S> the church<S>1577</S>, he went down<S>2597</S> to<S>1519</S> Antioch<S>490</S>.
And<S>2532</S> after he had spent<S>4160</S> some<S>5100</S> time<S>5550</S> there, he departed<S>1831</S>, and went over<S>1330</S> all the country<S>5561</S> of Galatia<S>1054</S> and<S>2532</S> Phrygia<S>5435</S> in order<S>2517</S>, strengthening<S>1991</S> all<S>3956</S> the disciples<S>3101</S>.
And<S>1161</S> a certain<S>5100</S> Jew<S>2453</S> named<S>3686</S> Apollos<S>625</S>, born<S>1085</S> at Alexandria<S>221</S>, an eloquent<S>3052</S> man<S>435</S>, and mighty<S>5607</S> <S>1415</S> in<S>1722</S> the scriptures<S>1124</S>, came<S>2658</S> to<S>1519</S> Ephesus<S>2181</S>.
This man<S>3778</S> was<S>2258</S> instructed in<S>2727</S> the way<S>3598</S> of the Lord<S>2962</S>; and<S>2532</S> being fervent<S>2204</S> in the spirit<S>4151</S>, he spake<S>2980</S> and<S>2532</S> taught<S>1321</S> diligently<S>199</S> the things of<S>4012</S> the Lord<S>2962</S>, knowing<S>1987</S> only<S>3440</S> the baptism<S>908</S> of John<S>2491</S>.
And<S>5037</S> he<S>3778</S> began<S>756</S> to speak boldly<S>3955</S> in<S>1722</S> the synagogue<S>4864</S>: whom<S>846</S> when<S>1161</S> Aquila<S>207</S> and<S>2532</S> Priscilla<S>4252</S> had heard<S>191</S>, they took<S>4355</S> him<S>846</S> unto them, and<S>2532</S> expounded<S>1620</S> unto him<S>846</S> the way<S>3598</S> of God<S>2316</S> more perfectly<S>197</S>.
And<S>1161</S> when he<S>846</S> was disposed<S>1014</S> to pass<S>1330</S> into<S>1519</S> Achaia<S>882</S>, the brethren<S>80</S> wrote<S>1125</S>, exhorting<S>4389</S> the disciples<S>3101</S> to receive<S>588</S> him<S>846</S>: who<S>3739</S>, when he was come<S>3854</S>, helped them<S>4820</S> much<S>4183</S> which had believed<S>4100</S> through<S>1223</S> grace<S>5485</S>:
For<S>1063</S> he mightily<S>2159</S> convinced<S>1246</S> the Jews<S>2453</S>, and that publickly<S>1219</S>, shewing<S>1925</S> by<S>1223</S> the scriptures<S>1124</S> that Jesus<S>2424</S> was<S>1511</S> Christ<S>5547</S>. <sup>Christ: or, is the Christ</sup>
